Params: Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory752.jpg
Noctis
This is crazy...
Noctis leans against the window, staring at the street below. It is already late in the night, but there are still quite a few people wandering.
Noctis
At least 5 are watching us. The entire town would know if we ever go out.
With a sigh, Noctis sits back on the inn bed and lies down in boredom.
Noctis
How are we going to catch that bastard like this...?
Max arranged—or, forced—you to stay in the inn he picked.
Like he said, everything from Babylonia is not welcome in this town. You will not be able to find Daemon by running through each and every house.
That mayor did mention that the town would be temporarily closed.
You heard that the town would be closed for the annual Harvest Festival. No unauthorized personnel can leave and enter the town easily, so there is a high chance that Daemon is still inside the town.
Noctis
I just don't know how much we can trust that old man.
By the way, Noctis, I've something to ask you.
Noctis crosses his arms on the bed with an indifferent look. Perhaps he has already anticipated your question.
Noctis
Hmph, ask whatever you want, but it's up to me whether I want to answer them or not.
Alright. First of all, you didn't blow up the shuttle, did you?
Noctis
Will you believe me if I say no...?
Noctis sneers and laughs, but soon becomes serious again.
Noctis
I'm the only one in this world who can mix that kind of explosives... Or, I am supposed to be the only one.
Supposed to be...?
Noctis
Yeah. Other than me, only two people are supposed to know this formula, but... They both died right in front of me. Like, very dead.
Noctis looks at his own reflection in the window. The marks of that battle are still visible.
Noctis
But... I'm not so sure anymore. Dammit.
Why would Daemon set you up then?
Noctis
How am I supposed to know... What was he even thinking?
Who's this "Generalissimo" he mentioned?
Noctis
Some great guy... Maybe. I don't know shit...
And...
Noctis is getting a little annoyed. He suddenly bounces up from the bed.
Noctis
Wait a minute, why am I the only one answering your questions? It's not fair. I have something to ask you too!
Alright...
You have no idea why he is suddenly obsessed about being "fair"...
Noctis
First one. Why did you show up with that guy at that place...?
As expected, Noctis was unaware of Daemon's intention. You have to explain to him again what Daemon did.
Noctis
You must be that guy's target all along... He just wanted to pin it on me. I'm gonna skin him alive and make him regret installing a pain sensor...
Noctis
Okay. Your turn now... Ask me!
Tell me about "New Oakley". You mentioned this name in the shuttle too.
Noctis
Tch... You sure are a sharp one...
Why did you know this place before we even came here?
Noctis remains silent for a while before speaking again.
Noctis
It's related to the two dead people I mentioned earlier... One of them was Nigel. I knew him well back in the Purifying Force... And he was the last one I killed as a Purifying Force member.
Nigel... You have never heard of that name. None of the Purifying Force members ever talked about him either.
Noctis
To put it simply... Someone saw him in a small town on the surface. The name of that town just happened to be New Oakley.
From Noctis' reaction, this Nigel guy definitely means more than "someone he knew well" to him.
Daemon could be related to this guy you are after.
Noctis
Exactly! That's what I thought too... There's no other way he would know my formula.
Noctis starts to get excited as the truth gets gradually unraveled.
Noctis
Alright, my turn. Why would Daemon go through all that effort just to take you to this place?
Hmm... Good question.
If he simply drove the vehicle away from the Purifying Force's crash-landing site, he would have caught you off guard and probably had a better chance.
Still, he insisted on coming to this town first and blew up the bridge. It raised an alert and eventually led to his failure.
Perhaps he did not specifically arrange for an ambush here. Rather, his men were always stationed around this town.
There could be other defectors like Daemon living in this town.
Noctis
Are you saying... That this town is full of their people?
Probably not...
Noctis
Right. We probably wouldn't have survived till now if that was the case.
The mayor doesn't like us, but at least he hasn't harmed us.
Noctis
So we're back to the same question. How are we going to find him...
Noctis
Gargh! This is not going anywhere...
It's my turn to ask now.
Noctis
Okay! Bring it on!
Why did you run away...?
Noctis did not see this coming. He looks a little shocked.
Noctis
Why...? I told you I came here to check if Nigel was still alive!
But why didn't you talk to others first?
Noctis
Talk...? Nah. It's my own business. I don't need to get them involved.
In fact, both the Purifying Force and I are already involved.
Noctis
So are Vera and No. 21.
Noctis
C'mon, what does it have to do with them?!
They are worried about you...
Noctis
Vera? Worried about me? You must be hallucinating...
Noctis almost fails to hold back laughter, but he just sighs and keeps his mouth shut.
Noctis
What a bloody mess. I chose to investigate alone because I didn't want to bother them...
Let's find a way to go back to the Purifying Force tomorrow and explain to them.
Noctis
Hell no! I'm never going back... And neither can you!
Noctis is very adamant about it. Still, you can tell that he is no longer as impulsive as he was at the beginning.
Noctis
You're just too naive. Some of those Purifying Force members could very well be related to the defectors.
I just don't want to suspect our comrades without grounds...
Noctis
I know, neither do I. Still... You can't completely trust someone, even if they are your closest family and friends.
Noctis
Anyway, I'll go to the town tomorrow and continue investigating... They probably won't like us doing so, but there's no other way.
But I'll keep an eye on you.
Disgruntled, Noctis lies down on the bed and closes his eyes.
Noctis
Whatever you like...
Thinking too much is not going to help. What you need the most right now is to rest and keep a clear mind.
DialogDisable
Good night then...
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory752.jpg
Compared to the tranquil lounge in Babylonia, the inn in the small town feels a lot noisier.
The howling wind, the chirping of unknown insects... and the loud, off-key singing of drunk people...
Despite all this, you feel a strange sense of peace embraced by such a chaotic mix of sounds. The scent of dried wheat straws filling the beds and pillows also makes you feel incredibly comfortable.
Noctis
Hey, are you asleep yet?
Hmm... Almost.
Noctis
I'll ask you one last question then...
Noctis
Aren't you worried that I may also be on the defectors' side? Why do you trust everything I said?
I don't know either... Out of instinct, maybe?
Noctis
Instinct... Never thought I would hear that word from you.
Instincts are crucial, you know.
Perhaps compared to the experiences gained from all the past adventures, you should sometimes trust your instincts more when making a decision.
Noctis
You really are a strange one... Don't say I didn't warn you, but you might also be considered a defector if you keep messing around with me.
Whether you are innocent or not... That's my own decision to make.
Noctis
It probably doesn't matter anymore though... I guess nobody cares about what happened back then and right now, except me.
If you really are innocent...
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory550.jpg
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory550.jpg
You look up at the night sky and slowly close your eyes as fatigue begins to creep in.
I still... hope you can return to Cerberus with your head held high...
Enveloped by a sense of relaxation, you gradually fall asleep.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory752.jpg
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory752.jpg
Noctis
Tch... Why care about me so much? This thing has nothing to do with you...
Lying down, Noctis crosses his arms and lets out a sigh. He closes his eyes with a faint smile.
Noctis
Return to Cerberus... Alright, that's my next goal after catching this Daemon guy. I'm gonna shock Vera and 21.
DialogDisable
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory732.jpg
Watanabe and the officers of other departments rarely come together, but today they have gathered in the Forsaken HQ.
The tactical map in front of them is filled with all types of symbols. Out of all, the most eye-catching one is a circle centered around the Inver-Hetero Tower—the Clean Zone.
Watanabe
Are you sure about that?
Area Officer
Yes... Area 2 was suddenly attacked by some Hetero-Creatures with rather strange behaviors.
Area Officer
Although they seem... less aggressive than the known types, they are surprisingly coordinated and move in groups. Our existing defenses can hardly stop them.
Watanabe
It seems the Punishing creatures are also constantly changing. It could all be linked to the emergence of that tower.
Area Officer
Watanabe, I know you are still negotiating with Babylonia. But I'm afraid I can't hold everybody back. Some people have started entering the Clean Zone. I'm extremely sorry...
Watanabe
That's not your fault...
Watanabe gazes at the chart representing the spreading of Hetero-Creatures with a complicated look on his face as he realizes more areas may be affected in the future.
Military Officer
But Babylonia has been claiming they need to inspect more areas within the Clean Zone before letting people in to avoid more chaos. Who knows if they are just delaying us on purpose...
The military officer's words seem to resonate with many attendees. Many begin to express their dissatisfaction with Babylonia to varying degrees.
Watanabe
I have reached an agreement with Babylonia. They promised an appropriate allocation of civilians... There's no need to worry about that aspect.
Watanabe browses through the attendees. He makes a faint but determined smile.
Watanabe
I know very well that there has always been some tension between the Forsaken and Babylonia due to historical reasons.
Watanabe
But recently, Babylonia had proved their attitude through a series of actions... I believe you all have witnessed them.
During this time, many Forsaken members have fought alongside Babylonia forces and helped each other on various occasions. Their impression of Babylonia has been significantly enhanced.
Watanabe
So I ask you all to show a little more patience. Regarding the Hetero-Creatures, I will also come up with a solution ASAP.
Watanabe
That's all for today. You are dismissed.
Forsakens
Yes, Sir!

Watanabe examines the reports he received from various Forsaken camps with a grave look. According to them, there have already been quite a number of conflicts between the Forsaken members and the Clean Zone's defense forces.
He has managed to keep the negative emotions under control this time, but no one can predict when they will fully explode.
Watanabe
What do you think about this, Instructor?
Watanabe turns toward a shadowed corner, asking a man who had been listening to the entire discussion.
This seasoned veteran is about the age of Watanabe's father. Watanabe invited him to help with new Forsaken recruit training not long ago.
I advise you not to fully trust Babylonia's promises.
When there are conflicts of interest, your friends can turn into your worst enemies, no matter how much you used to trust each other.
Besides... There are still different voices in Babylonia who want to get rid of the Forsaken altogether.
Watanabe
You are right. We should always negotiate with great caution. But personally, I still want to believe that Babylonia is capable of handling all this...
Watanabe
But before reaching a final agreement with Babylonia, we need to stop the expansion of those Hetero-Creatures first.
In that case, I would suggest you establish a line of defense near the area where the Hetero-Creatures came from... Babylonia seems to call it the "Hetero Zone".
Watanabe
But we don't have enough military strength right now...
Should I take some soldiers with me and head to the Hetero Zone first? So we can eliminate some of the Hetero-Creatures?
Watanabe contemplates the suggestion for quite some time, but shakes his head eventually.
Watanabe
The Forsaken had many new members recently, but they still need more training in both discipline and combat abilities. We can't rush it.
Watanabe
And since we're trying to regain the Forsaken's confidence as a whole, I think I should lead this operation to better boost the morale of our forces.
Stroking his beard, the man nods with a smile.
I'm glad to see you considering things more thoroughly now, Watanabe. Just do as you wish then.
Watanabe
Alright. Time is of the essence, I'll go with them to hold off the Hetero-Creatures tomorrow...
The man nods and walks out of the shadows. He pats Watanabe on the shoulder.
We'll take care of things here. The Forsaken... will be waiting for your triumphant return.
